intro: Brexia lucanana, commonly known as the Lucanian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern Italy. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Brexia lucanana has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, clustered flowers during the summer months. It is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats, where it contributes to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
